caption: A lovely oasis within the city - a different way to see the suburbs. Unfortunately, most of the lifts on the 15th arrondissment are broken due to vandalism or lack of maintenance, so the advertised disabled access is not possible. If your legs are good, this is a great walk, away from the hot concrete and bitumen, and the noise and smell of traffic.

This is a nice, easy, flat walk. Not a lot of special attractions, just an opportunity for some fresh air. The vegetation is wildflowers, not any kind of ordered garden. Take a moment to look, they are pretty. There are interesting signs all along, and multiple places to enter and leave.
Very nice, free of cars
Great walk on an old railway, transformed to park...
Love this place, cool, green and no cars
One of the best place in Paris
Lovely little space to walķ

This walk is an element of the small ring of the 15th, accessible by a staircase via rue Leblanc. The Petite Ceinture, a 32 km railway line, was built around Paris during the Second Empire (1852-1869). The section from Place Balard to Rue Olivier de Serres was closed to travelers in 1934, but remained used by freight trains until the 1980s. Vegetation is gradually taking hold on railway structures, creating habitats conducive to flora and fauna. This railway and natural context that it is up to everyone to preserve favors the creation of this green space which has retained its original wasteland character while integrating into the urban fabric.
Unusual place very nice walk
A nice little walk along these railway tracks which is relaxing but still a little short to follow.
Ideal place for a quiet walk or a jog in the greenery in the middle of Paris.
Beautiful little green walk where you can also venture into the surrounding neighborhoods.

It's a magnificent place, especially the restored part of the 15th century because I'm from the 14th century and they haven't put an elevator there because older people like me have trouble with the stairs. Also work did not continue to unite the two districts. In this time of pandemic it's so nice to be able to go out and get some fresh air.

at 10 a.m., almost no one! on a curfew Saturday, this place is magical! silence, pure air, calm walkers and runners at short trots, attentive to their breathing, and few enough in number not to disturb pedestrians. note: a lot of "without masks" since we are sufficiently far from each other...and such a need to "breathe"..happy dogs too, often old, sometimes detached from their leash, who still trot to the rhythm of their owner.
May be a very particular and little-known Parisian park. Really nice to do after a good restaurant.

Nice walk outside of Paris but in Paris at the same time... You would never suspect these paths when you drive underneath them! Too bad that from October to February the promenade closes at 4:45 p.m.: we are kicked out by guards immediately! Be careful, the walk is made up of several sections, you cannot go around Paris in one go!
A real breath of fresh air in Paris, unlike the planned and concreted Parisian "parks" everywhere here you really feel the calm and nature in the wild, an excellent walk to disconnect.
Green change of scenery In the middle of Urban wildlife
My favorite place to run. A little over 1km one way (on flat ground) with road markings every 100m. Ideal for running in Paris while absorbing less polluted air and midges.

Beautiful walk. Calm and green. There are benches. No particular view but given that we are in the middle of Paris, no miracle. Ideal for running or avoiding going in circles in a park. Closes relatively early in the evening.
Amazing walk along the 15th without really being there.

Nice walk in the 15th arrondissement of Paris along a stretch of an old railway from Balard to George Brassen park. The only flaws are the limited length. The old railway would in fact allow for a much longer route (ideally a complete belt around Paris) but only small sections have been recovered and rehabilitated for now...let's hope for the future 😉

Quiet, long green space where you can go jogging in complete tranquility. There are also spaces where you can sit in the sun or in the shade. Accessible for people with motor disabilities by elevators. There are at least 4 different entrances. Its length is approximately 1.4 km.

Nice walk to take with the family to find some greenery in the heart of Paris. However, you can quickly get bored, for those looking for more originality I advise you to take the passages of the small belt which are to the north east (Be careful, you have to know how to climb)
Very interesting, quiet in the heart of Paris
A green space on the old "fortifs" and the old ring railway south of Paris. A stroll in calm and greenery in the heart of the city. Floor maintenance could be better, however (mud, shiny floors etc.)

An old train line converted into a green walk in the 80s. This was the precursor of another similar line in New York, much more famous than this one but this was the first. It is a very pleasant walk with views of the streets of Paris from above. It is very worth walking through it.
Surprising walk on a rehabilitated railway line. There is no way to do a complete tour of Paris and depending on the area the walks are more or less interesting (I really like the 15th part)

Concession allocated to the Paris town hall by the SNCF in order to make a temporary park on the tracks of the old inner ring road, which was built in sections from the 1870s in order to complete the metro network set up for the universal exhibition of 1900. It was used until 1932 by workers then only for freight transport. The last train passed there in the 90s. Since then the tracks have been abandoned.

This piece of the famous little belt (former Parisian railway line) is located south of the 15th arrondissement, it goes from Balard to rue de Serres and it is a real pleasure to walk there. Here we have created a walk while respecting nature, wooden plank and large gravel to materialize the route and we let the flowers, plants and other shrubs grow as they wish.
Walk of 1.5km maximum. Very pleasant to do with the family. Suitable for pedestrians, bicycles but not rollerblades
Both sober and essential, like a forest path in the heart of Paris. At one end we arrive in a few streets at the Brassens park, at the other end the Citroën park
Great place, a little bit of greenery, a place which has a history, however the schedules are not in sync with the parks, Brassens in particular, it's a shame...
It’s a shame that the promenade doesn’t benefit from more entertainment. Drinks and street food businesses would be welcome.
Very surprising and very pleasant Parisian location because it is away from the madness of Paris. But the walk from end to end is short
nice walk in a quiet place in Paris... nice views from the old train route of the petite ceinture of Paris
The plants in District 15 are pretty good. The park has many varieties and is safe and quiet.
Nice high walk on a historic railway line, beautiful views and good access.
